condition.description:
Depression is a serious medical illness that involves the brain. It's more than just a feeling of being "down in the dumps" or "blue" for a few days. If you are one of the more than 20 million people in the United States who have depression, the feelings do not go away. They persist and interfere with your everyday life. Symptoms can include

  • Sadness
  • Loss of interest or pleasure in activities you used to enjoy
  • Change in weight
  • Difficulty sleeping or oversleeping
  • Energy loss
  • Feelings of worthlessness
  • Thoughts of death or suicide

Depression is a disorder of the brain. There are a variety of causes, including genetic, environmental, psychological, and biochemical factors. Depression usually starts between the ages of 15 and 30, and is much more common in women. Women can also get postpartum depression after the birth of a baby. Some people get seasonal affective disorder in the winter. Depression is one part of bipolar disorder.

There are effective treatments for depression, including antidepressants and talk therapy. Most people do best by using both.

NIH: National Institute of Mental Health

basics.benefits_moa: Abilify is an atypical antipsychotic. Researchers don't know exactly how it works. It seems to change dopamine and serotonin activity in your brain, which affects thoughts and mood.
basics.bottom_line: Abilify is good for treating psychosis and mania, and can help with depression. Less likely to cause side effects than any other antipsychotic, but has a risk of suicidal thoughts for people age 24 and younger.
downsides: Mild risk of Extrapyramidal Symptoms (EPS): Movement disorders that include stiffness, tremor, restlessness, and slow, repetitive, or involuntary movements.
Can cause higher risk of suicidal thoughts and behavior for people age 24 and younger.
You might need routine blood tests to check how the medicine is affecting your body.
All antipsychotics come with side effects that make them difficult to take. You might need to try a few different medicines until you find one that works for you and that you can tolerate.
Not available as a generic, so it's more expensive.

userStories.tip: I was on Abilify for almost 8 months with no improvement in depression, in fact I became a depressed tank! Within 7 months, I went from 130 to 180 lbs., I'm  5'2"!! Pdoc didn't seemed concerned, but my rheumatologist sure did.

The Dr. prescribed  5mg Abilify in addition to 40 mg Prozac for my daughter's Anxiety Disorders.   She was 10 years old (now 11).  She gained 30 pounds in 11 months.  Discontinuing Abilify now.  Considering Latuda??
It is really expensive if you don't have insurance, but I seem to feel a lot better and more present in my own mind.

I have taken this for one day and I cannot eat, drink, or even move without severe nausea and sweating. I'm becoming more psychotic as I can compare this 100% to Risperidone. I've had suicidal thoughts and have been becoming angry.
I just wanted to sleep all the time.

All it does is makes you sick to your stomach and not able to sleep. Then when I stop I find my food & drink are being laced with it. BEWARE THIS PHARMA COMPANY IS A BUNCH OF STALKERS! DO NOT TAKE ANYTHING FROM THEM!
My brain felt great, but my body did not - experienced weight gain and severe constipation.
Damaging effects of the drug.

Insomnia every night. If you can't sleep you can't function. Nausea, diahreehea, anxiety, low blood sugar, hypoglycaemia which causes, weakness, dizziness and fatigue. When I wasn't nauseas, I was starving. If I slept, hunger would wake me.
Can cause blood sugar to go so high you get pancreatitis
I ended up having to take only 2.5 mg per day so I wouldn't fall asleep driving. It is hard to cut up a 10 mg tablet into fourths but it seemed to help.
Always keep a steady supply so you don't run out. Withdrawals are no fun. I felt an electric shock sensation all throughout my body
ugh. tried coming off it, made me suicidal. now i'm back on
taking for bi polar and depression

Makes you energized. Take in the morning to avoid difficulty sleeping.

risks_warnings.title: Increased risk of death
risks_warnings.description: Older patients with dementia-related psychosis have a higher risk of death when treated with antipsychotic medications. Abilify is not approved to treat dementia-related psychosis.

description_processed.orig: Older patients with dementia-related psychosis have a higher risk of death when treated with antipsychotic medications. Abilify is not approved to treat dementia-related psychosis.

risks_warnings.title: Suicidal thoughts or behavior
risks_warnings.description: Abilify may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately. Abilify is not approved for use in children younger than age 18.

description_processed.orig: Abilify may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately. Abilify is not approved for use in children younger than age 18.

risks_warnings.title: Blood disorders
risks_warnings.description: Rarely, Abilify can lower white blood cell counts. White blood cells help your body fight infections. Tell your doctor if you have any infection symptoms (such as fever, sore throat, or mouth/throat swelling) that don't go away. You may need routine blood tests while on this medication.

Tell your doctor if you have any infection symptoms (such as fever, sore throat, or mouth/throat swelling) that don't go away. You may need routine blood tests while on this medication.

risks_warnings.title: Neuroleptic malignant syndrome
risks_warnings.description: This is a rare but life-threatening condition associated with all antipsychotic (neuroleptic) medications. Symptoms include high fever, fast heart rate, full body stiffness, and confusion. Seek medical attention immediately.

description_processed.orig: This is a rare but life-threatening condition associated with all antipsychotic (neuroleptic) medications. Symptoms include high fever, fast heart rate, full body stiffness, and confusion. Seek medical attention immediately.

risks_warnings.title: Heart problems
risks_warnings.description: Abilify can increase your risk of irregular heartbeat. However, Abilify causes fewer heart problems compared to some antipsychotic medications. Heart and blood tests may be required before starting treatment.

description_processed.orig: Abilify can increase your risk of irregular heartbeat. However, Abilify causes fewer heart problems compared to some antipsychotic medications. Heart and blood tests may be required before starting treatment.

risks_warnings.title: Shaking and restlessness
risks_warnings.description: Abilify can cause uncontrollable shaking, muscle stiffness, or feeling very restless. However, Abilify is less likely to cause these symptoms compared to other antipsychotic medications. Tell your doctor if you experience any abnormal movements or restlessness.

description_processed.orig: Abilify can cause uncontrollable shaking, muscle stiffness, or feeling very restless. However, Abilify is less likely to cause these symptoms compared to other antipsychotic medications. Tell your doctor if you experience any abnormal movements or restlessness.

risks_warnings.title: Higher blood sugar and cholesterol
risks_warnings.description: Abilify can increase your blood sugar and cholesterol. However, Abilify is the least likely to raise your blood sugar and cholesterol compared to other antipsychotic medications. Exercise and eat healthy food to lower your risk.

description_processed.orig: Abilify can increase your blood sugar and cholesterol. However, Abilify is the least likely to raise your blood sugar and cholesterol compared to other antipsychotic medications. Exercise and eat healthy food to lower your risk.

risks_warnings.title: Weight gain
risks_warnings.description: Abilify can cause you to gain weight. Abilify is the least likely to cause weight gain compared to other antipsychotic medications. Exercise and eat healthy food to lower your risk.

description_processed.orig: Abilify can cause you to gain weight. Abilify is the least likely to cause weight gain compared to other antipsychotic medications. Exercise and eat healthy food to lower your risk.

risks_warnings.title: Driving impairment
risks_warnings.description: Abilify impairs your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.
risk_factors: Taking other medicines that make you less alert

description_processed.orig: Abilify impairs your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.

risks_warnings.title: Low blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: Dizziness and falls may occur due to a sudden drop in blood pressure when you change positions, such as going from sitting to standing. This is called orthostatic hypotension. If you're sensitive to low blood pressure, change position slowly until your body is used to the medicine. If symptoms persist, a different medication may be better for you.

This is called orthostatic hypotension. If you're sensitive to low blood pressure, change position slowly until your body is used to the medicine. If symptoms persist, a different medication may be better for you.

risks_warnings.title: Phenylketonuria (PKU)
risks_warnings.description: Abilify Discmelt contains Aspartame (phenylalanine). People who have phenylketonuria (PKU) can't break down the amino acid phenylalanine. It builds up and causes serious medical problems. If you have PKU don't take the  Discmelt. You can still take the oral swallow tablet.

basics.benefits_moa: Citalopram is a selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor (SSRI) antidepressant. It increases serotonin activity in the brain, which regulates mood.
basics.bottom_line: Citalopram is good for treating depression and anxiety. Might be less likely to cause side effects than some antidepressants, but not the best choice for people with heart or liver problems.
downsides: Can cause sexual side effects like low libido and an inability to orgasm or ejaculate.
Can cause minor weight gain (1 to 5 pounds).
Citalopram can cause an irregular heartbeat if you take a high dose (40 mg a day, or more).
Not a good option for you if you have heart or liver problems.
Like most antidepressants, it can cause a higher risk of suicidal thoughts and behavior for people younger than 24 years.
The first antidepressant you try doesn't always work or it can cause side effects you really don't like. You might need to try a few different medications until you find one that works for you.

carousel_items_processed.orig: Take with food to avoid upset stomach.
Takes about 8 to 12 weeks to see the medication's full effects on your mood.
Stop taking it slowly to avoid getting withdrawal symptoms.
Tell your doctor if you notice sudden mood changes or unusual thoughts.

risks_warnings.title: Suicidal thoughts or behavior
risks_warnings.description: Citalopram may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately. Citalopram is not approved for use in children younger than age 18.

description_processed.orig: Citalopram may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately. Citalopram is not approved for use in children younger than age 18.

risks_warnings.title: Serotonin syndrome
risks_warnings.description: Serotonin syndrome is a rare but potentially life-threatening condition caused when there's too much serotonin active in the brain. Your risk goes up if you use Citalopram with other medications that affect serotonin (other antidepressants, lithium, triptans, St. John's wort). Symptoms include fast heart rate, sweating, muscle stiffness or spasms, fever, and confusion. Get medical attention right away if you have symptoms.
risk_factors: Using other medications that affect serotonin

description_processed.orig: Serotonin syndrome is a rare but potentially life-threatening condition caused when there's too much serotonin active in the brain. Your risk goes up if you use Citalopram with other medications that affect serotonin (other antidepressants, lithium, triptans, St. John's wort). Symptoms include fast heart rate, sweating, muscle stiffness or spasms, fever, and confusion. Get medical attention right away if you have symptoms.

risks_warnings.title: Mania
risks_warnings.description: Sometimes, depression is the first symptom of bipolar disorder. Treating someone with bipolar disorder with an antidepressant alone can cause a manic episode (great excitement, euphoria, delusions, and overactivity). Make sure your doctor has screened you for a personal or family history of bipolar disorder or symptoms, and a family history of suicide.

description_processed.orig: Sometimes, depression is the first symptom of bipolar disorder. Treating someone with bipolar disorder with an antidepressant alone can cause a manic episode (great excitement, euphoria, delusions, and overactivity). Make sure your doctor has screened you for a personal or family history of bipolar disorder or symptoms, and a family history of suicide.

risks_warnings.title: Withdrawal
risks_warnings.description: Stopping Citalopram suddenly may cause withdrawal symptoms such as nausea, anxiety, agitation, flu-like symptoms, trouble sleeping, and dizziness. Withdrawal symptoms usually occur within 3 days of stopping the medication, and go away within 1 to 2 weeks. Work with your doctor to gradually reduce your dose.

description_processed.orig: Stopping Citalopram suddenly may cause withdrawal symptoms such as nausea, anxiety, agitation, flu-like symptoms, trouble sleeping, and dizziness. Withdrawal symptoms usually occur within 3 days of stopping the medication, and go away within 1 to 2 weeks. Work with your doctor to gradually reduce your dose.

risks_warnings.title: Heart problems
risks_warnings.description: People with a history of heart or liver problems and people that are older are at increased risk for heart problems from taking Citalopram. These people need a lower maximum dose (20 mg or less a day). Heart and blood tests may be required before treatment.

description_processed.orig: People with a history of heart or liver problems and people that are older are at increased risk for heart problems from taking Citalopram. These people need a lower maximum dose (20 mg or less a day). Heart and blood tests may be required before treatment.

risks_warnings.title: Increased bleeding
risks_warnings.description: Citalopram can increase the risk of bleeding or bruising if you're also taking aspirin, NSAIDs (like ibuprofen), warfarin, or other anticoagulants. Tell your doctor about any bruising that doesn't improve, black stools, pink or red urine, or unusual bleeding (for example, from the nose or gums).

description_processed.orig: Citalopram can increase the risk of bleeding or bruising if you're also taking aspirin, NSAIDs (like ibuprofen), warfarin, or other anticoagulants. Tell your doctor about any bruising that doesn't improve, black stools, pink or red urine, or unusual bleeding (for example, from the nose or gums).

risks_warnings.title: Sexual dysfunction
risks_warnings.description: Citalopram can cause lower sex drive or difficulty having an orgasm. If the problem persists after the first 2 to 3 months, you can talk to your doctor about alternative antidepressants or performance-enhancing medications.

basics.benefits_moa: Cymbalta is a serotonin and norepinephrine reuptake inhibitor (SNRI) antidepressant. It increases serotonin and norepinephrine activity in the brain, which regulates mood.
basics.bottom_line: Cymbalta is good for treating depression and anxiety, and may help with chronic pain. More likely than other antidepressants to cause problems if you drink or have high blood pressure.
downsides: Not a good option if you're a heavy drinker, or if you have liver or kidney problems.

drugs.name: Cymbalta

carousel_items_processed.orig: Take with food to avoid upset stomach.
Full effects in 8 to 12 weeks for mood, 2 weeks for pain.
Stop taking slowly to avoid withdrawal symptoms.
Tell your doctor if you notice sudden mood changes or unusual thoughts.

risks_warnings.title: Suicidal thoughts or behavior
risks_warnings.description: Cymbalta may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately. Cymbalta is not approved for use in children younger than age 18.

description_processed.orig: Cymbalta may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately. Cymbalta is not approved for use in children younger than age 18.

risks_warnings.title: Serotonin syndrome
risks_warnings.description: Serotonin syndrome is a rare but potentially life-threatening condition caused when there's too much serotonin active in the brain. Your risk goes up if you use Cymbalta with other medications that affect serotonin (other antidepressants, lithium, triptans, St. John's wort). Symptoms include fast heart rate, sweating, muscle stiffness or spasms, fever, and confusion. Get medical attention right away if you have symptoms.
risk_factors: Using other medications that affect serotonin

description_processed.orig: Serotonin syndrome is a rare but potentially life-threatening condition caused when there's too much serotonin active in the brain. Your risk goes up if you use Cymbalta with other medications that affect serotonin (other antidepressants, lithium, triptans, St. John's wort). Symptoms include fast heart rate, sweating, muscle stiffness or spasms, fever, and confusion. Get medical attention right away if you have symptoms.

risks_warnings.title: Withdrawal
risks_warnings.description: Stopping Cymbalta suddenly may cause withdrawal symptoms such as nausea, anxiety, agitation, flu-like symptoms, trouble sleeping, and dizziness. Withdrawal symptoms usually occur within 3 days of stopping the medication, and go away within 1 to 2 weeks. Work with your doctor to gradually reduce your dose.

description_processed.orig: Stopping Cymbalta suddenly may cause withdrawal symptoms such as nausea, anxiety, agitation, flu-like symptoms, trouble sleeping, and dizziness. Withdrawal symptoms usually occur within 3 days of stopping the medication, and go away within 1 to 2 weeks. Work with your doctor to gradually reduce your dose.

risks_warnings.title: High blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: Cymbalta can increase your blood pressure. Monitor your blood pressure regularly.

description_processed.orig: Cymbalta can increase your blood pressure. Monitor your blood pressure regularly.

risks_warnings.title: Increased bleeding
risks_warnings.description: Cymbalta can increase the risk of bleeding or bruising if you're also taking aspirin, NSAIDs (like ibuprofen), warfarin, or other anticoagulants. Tell your doctor about any bruising that doesn't improve, black stools, pink or red urine, or unusual bleeding (for example, from the nose or gums).

description_processed.orig: Cymbalta can increase the risk of bleeding or bruising if you're also taking aspirin, NSAIDs (like ibuprofen), warfarin, or other anticoagulants. Tell your doctor about any bruising that doesn't improve, black stools, pink or red urine, or unusual bleeding (for example, from the nose or gums).

risks_warnings.title: Sexual dysfunction
risks_warnings.description: Cymbalta can cause lower sex drive or difficulty having an orgasm. If the problem persists after the first 2 to 3 months, you can talk to your doctor about alternative antidepressants or performance-enhancing medications.

description_processed.orig: Cymbalta can cause lower sex drive or difficulty having an orgasm. If the problem persists after the first 2 to 3 months, you can talk to your doctor about alternative antidepressants or performance-enhancing medications.

risks_warnings.title: Mania
risks_warnings.description: Sometimes, depression is the first symptom of bipolar disorder. Treating someone with bipolar disorder with an antidepressant alone can cause a manic episode (great excitement, euphoria, delusions, and overactivity). Make sure your doctor has screened you for a personal or family history of bipolar disorder or symptoms, and a family history of suicide.

carousel_items: Takes about 8 to 12 weeks to see the medication's full effects on your mood.
You can take the extended-release form once a day with food either in the morning or in the evening at about the same time each day.
Extended-release capsules should be swallowed whole. If you can’t swallow pills, open the capsule, sprinkle it on a spoonful of applesauce and then swallow it without chewing.
Stop taking it slowly to avoid getting withdrawal symptoms.
Tell your doctor if you notice sudden mood changes or unusual thoughts.

basics.benefits_moa: Venlafaxine is a serotonin and norepinephrine reuptake inhibitor (SNRI) antidepressant. It increases serotonin and norepinephrine activity in the brain, which regulate mood.
basics.bottom_line: Venlafaxine is good for treating depression and anxiety. May work when other antidepressants haven't, it's but more likely to cause side effects and withdrawal symptoms than other antidepressants.
downsides: Can cause sexual side effects like low libido and an inability to orgasm or ejaculate.
Not the best option for people with high blood pressure.
Overdosing on this medication could be fatal.
It's more likely to cause nausea and vomiting or make you feel sick if you miss a dose than other antidepressants. Also causes more sleepiness than others.
Like most antidepressants, it can cause a higher risk of suicidal thoughts and behavior for people younger than 24.
The first antidepressant you try doesn't always work or it can cause side effects you really don't like. You might need to try a few different medications until you find one that works for you.

upsides: Effective at relieving depression and anxiety symptoms.
Lowers relapse rates of depression.
Causes more sleepiness than other antidepressants, so it's good for people who have trouble sleeping.
Six out of ten people who use an antidepressant for the first time find that it works for them.
Might work when other antidepressants haven't worked since it affects two chemicals in the brain that impact your mood. Many other antidepressants affect only serotonin, but not norepinephrine too.

Pristiq is the metabolite of Effexor - ie, Effexor is converted into pristiq by your liver. It becomes the same drug, pristiq will have less side effects
Had a heart attack & needed for depression.  Till help with hot flashes also.  Trying now to wean off, extremely slow process with dizziness and some headache.

basics.benefits_moa: Amitriptyline is a tricyclic antidepressant (TCA). Researchers don't know exactly how it works. It may change serotonin and norepinephrine activity in the brain, which regulates mood and pain perception. It also has sedative effects.
basics.bottom_line: Amitriptyline is an older antidepressant that's sometimes used to treat pain and sleep problems, but it can have more side effects than similar medications.
downsides: When used for depression, Amitriptyline causes more side effects and has a higher risk of overdose than other antidepressants. It's usually used when other medications haven't worked.
It's more likely to cause sleepiness, nausea, constipation, diarrhea, and weight gain (1 to 5 pounds) than other antidepressants.
People age 65 and older have a higher risk for this medication's side effects.
Like most antidepressants, it can cause a higher risk of suicidal thoughts and behavior for people age 24 and younger.
The first antidepressant you try doesn't always work or it can cause side effects you really don't like. You might need to try a few different medications until you find one that works for you.

risks_warnings.title: Suicidal thoughts or behavior
risks_warnings.description: Amitriptyline may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately. Amitriptyline is not approved for use in children younger than age 18.

description_processed.orig: Amitriptyline may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. risks_warnings.title: Mania
risks_warnings.description: Sometimes, depression is the first symptom of bipolar disorder. Treating someone with bipolar disorder with an antidepressant alone can cause a manic episode (great excitement, euphoria, delusions, and overactivity). Make sure your doctor has screened you for a personal or family history of bipolar disorder or symptoms, and a family history of suicide.

description_processed.orig: Sometimes, depression is the first symptom of bipolar disorder. risks_warnings.title: Heart problems
risks_warnings.description: Amitriptyline has a higher risk of affecting heart rate control compared to other antidepressants. If you have a history of cardiovascular disease (including previous heart attack, stroke, fast/uncontrolled heart rate, or irregular heartbeat), talk to your doctor before use.

description_processed.orig: Amitriptyline has a higher risk of affecting heart rate control compared to other antidepressants. risks_warnings.title: Low blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: Dizziness and falls may occur due to a sudden drop in blood pressure when you change positions, such as going from sitting to standing. This is called orthostatic hypotension. If you're sensitive to low blood pressure, change position slowly until your body is used to the medicine. If symptoms persist, a different medication may be better for you.

risks_warnings.title: Anticholinergic effects
risks_warnings.description: Amitriptyline blocks acetylcholine, a nervous system chemical involved in many major bodily functions. Therefore, this medication commonly causes symptoms such as dry mouth, blurred vision, constipation, dizziness, and higher risk of falls.

basics.benefits_moa: Lexapro is a selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor (SSRI) antidepressant. It increases serotonin activity in the brain, which regulates mood.
basics.bottom_line: Lexapro is good for treating depression and anxiety. Might be less likely to cause side effects than some antidepressants, but not the best choice for people with heart or liver problems.
downsides: Can cause sexual side effects like low libido and an inability to orgasm or ejaculate.
More likely to cause minor weight gain (1 to 5 pounds) than other antidepressants.
Can cause an irregular heartbeat if you take a high dose (20 mg a day, or more).
Not a good option for you if you have heart or liver problems.
Like most antidepressants, it can cause a higher risk of suicidal thoughts and behavior for people younger than 24.

risks_warnings.title: Serotonin syndrome
risks_warnings.description: Serotonin syndrome is a rare but potentially life-threatening condition caused when there's too much serotonin active in the brain. Your risk goes up if you use Lexapro with other medications that affect serotonin (other antidepressants, lithium, triptans, St. John's wort). Symptoms include fast heart rate, sweating, muscle stiffness or spasms, fever, and confusion. Get medical attention right away if you have symptoms.

risks_warnings.title: Withdrawal
risks_warnings.description: Stopping Lexapro suddenly may cause withdrawal symptoms such as nausea, anxiety, agitation, flu-like symptoms, trouble sleeping, and dizziness. Withdrawal symptoms usually occur within 3 days of stopping the medication, and go away within 1 to 2 weeks. Work with your doctor to gradually reduce your dose.

risks_warnings.title: Heart problems
risks_warnings.description: Lexapro may affect your heart. If you have any risk factors, the maximum dose for you may be 10 mg or lower. Heart and blood tests may be required before starting treatment.

description_processed.orig: Lexapro may affect your heart. If you have any risk factors, the maximum dose for you may be 10 mg or lower. Heart and blood tests may be required before starting treatment.

risks_warnings.title: Increased bleeding
risks_warnings.description: Lexapro can increase the risk of bleeding or bruising if you're also taking aspirin, NSAIDs (like ibuprofen), warfarin, or other anticoagulants. Tell your doctor about any bruising that doesn't improve, black stools, pink or red urine, or unusual bleeding (for example, from the nose or gums).

risks_warnings.title: Sexual dysfunction
risks_warnings.description: Lexapro can cause lower sex drive or difficulty having an orgasm. If the problem persists after the first 2 to 3 months, you can talk to your doctor about alternative antidepressants or performance-enhancing medications.

risks_warnings.title: Low blood pressure

basics.benefits_moa: Nortriptyline is a tricyclic antidepressant (TCA). It helps improve your mood by altering the levels of serotonin, norepinephrine, and other similar chemicals in your brain.
basics.bottom_line: Nortriptyline is a good option for treating depression, especially for people who also have problems with persistent nerve pain.
downsides: Side effects are usually manageable, but can be annoying.
Increases the risk of falls, especially when used in the elderly.
There's an increased chance of it causing heart problems, especially in people with a history of heart problems.

risks_warnings.title: Low blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: Nortriptyline commonly cause a sudden drop in blood pressure, especially when you change positions, such as going from sitting to standing. risks_warnings.title: Withdrawal
risks_warnings.description: Stopping Nortriptyline suddenly may cause withdrawal symptoms such as nausea, anxiety, agitation, flu-like symptoms, trouble sleeping, and dizziness. Withdrawal symptoms usually occur within 3-5 days of stopping the medication, and go away within 1-2 weeks. Work with your doctor to gradually reduce your dose.

description_processed.orig: Stopping Nortriptyline suddenly may cause withdrawal symptoms such as nausea, anxiety, agitation, flu-like symptoms, trouble sleeping, and dizziness. Withdrawal symptoms usually occur within 3-5 days of stopping the medication, and go away within 1-2 weeks. Work with your doctor to gradually reduce your dose.

risks_warnings.title: Serotonin syndrome
risks_warnings.description: Serotonin syndrome is a rare but potentially life-threatening condition caused when there's too much serotonin active in the brain. Your risk goes up if you use Nortriptyline with other medications that affect serotonin (other antidepressants, lithium, triptans, St. John's wort). Symptoms include fast heart rate, sweating, muscle stiffness or spasms, fever, and confusion. Get medical attention right away if you have symptoms.

risks_warnings.title: Increased bleeding
risks_warnings.description: Paxil can increase the risk of bleeding or bruising if you're also taking aspirin, NSAIDs (like ibuprofen), warfarin, or other anticoagulants. Tell your doctor about any bruising that doesn't improve, black stools, pink or red urine, or unusual bleeding (for example, from the nose or gums).

risks_warnings.title: Sexual dysfunction
risks_warnings.description: Paxil can cause lower sex drive or difficulty having an orgasm. If the problem persists after the first 2 to 3 months, you can talk to your doctor about alternative antidepressants or performance-enhancing medications.

description_processed.orig: Paxil can cause lower sex drive or difficulty having an orgasm. If the problem persists after the first 2 to 3 months, you can talk to your doctor about alternative antidepressants or performance-enhancing medications.

risks_warnings.title: Mania
risks_warnings.description: Sometimes, depression is the first symptom of bipolar disorder. Treating someone with bipolar disorder with an antidepressant alone can cause a manic episode (great excitement, euphoria, delusions, and overactivity). Make sure your doctor has screened you for a personal or family history of bipolar disorder or symptoms, and a family history of suicide.

risks_warnings.title: Pregnancy
risks_warnings.description: Paxil can harm a developing fetus. Don't use it while pregnant, especially in the first trimester. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications.

basics.benefits_moa: Prozac is a selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor (SSRI) antidepressant. It increases serotonin activity in the brain, which regulates mood.
basics.bottom_line: Prozac is good for treating depression and anxiety. It's more energizing than other antidepressants, but may not be the best choice for people who have trouble sleeping.
downsides: Can cause sexual side effects like low libido and an inability to orgasm or ejaculate.
Can increase feelings of anxiety or cause headaches during the first few weeks of taking it. These effects should go away over time.
More likely than other antidepressants to interact with other medications you're taking.
Like most antidepressants, it can cause a higher risk of suicidal thoughts and behavior for people younger than 24.
The first antidepressant you try doesn't always work or it can cause side effects you really don't like. You might need to try a few different medications until you find one that works for you.

basics.bottom_line: Mirtazapine is okay for treating depression and good for sleep. More likely to cause weight gain than any other antidepressant.
downsides: Not as effective as other medications for depression.

drugs.name: Seroquel

carousel_items_processed.orig: Takes 4 to 6 weeks to see full effects on thoughts and mood.
Can cause dizziness, drowsiness, and low blood pressure.
For the first week, avoid activities that require you to be alert.
May cause weight gain and worsen cholesterol or blood sugar.
Report any unusual thoughts, inability to control muscle movements, or fever and excess sweating to your doctor.
Elderly people with dementia shouldn't take it.

risks_warnings.title: Increased risk of death
risks_warnings.description: Older patients with dementia-related psychosis have a higher risk of death when treated with antipsychotic medications. Seroquel is not approved to treat dementia-related psychosis.

description_processed.orig: Older patients with dementia-related psychosis have a higher risk of death when treated with antipsychotic medications. Seroquel is not approved to treat dementia-related psychosis.

risks_warnings.title: Blood disorders
risks_warnings.description: Rarely, Seroquel can lower white blood cell counts. White blood cells help your body fight infections. Tell your doctor if you have any infection symptoms (such as fever, sore throat, or mouth/throat swelling) that don't go away. You may need routine blood tests while on this medication.

description_processed.orig: Rarely, Seroquel can lower white blood cell counts. White blood cells help your body fight infections. Tell your doctor if you have any infection symptoms (such as fever, sore throat, or mouth/throat swelling) that don't go away. You may need routine blood tests while on this medication.

risks_warnings.title: Neuroleptic malignant syndrome
risks_warnings.description: This is a rare but life-threatening condition associated with all antipsychotic (neuroleptic) medications. Symptoms include high fever, fast heart rate, full body stiffness, and confusion. Seek medical attention immediately.

description_processed.orig: This is a rare but life-threatening condition associated with all antipsychotic (neuroleptic) medications. Symptoms include high fever, fast heart rate, full body stiffness, and confusion. Seek medical attention immediately.

risks_warnings.title: Heart problems
risks_warnings.description: Seroquel can increase your risk of irregular heartbeat. Seroquel causes more heart problems compared to some antipsychotic medications. Heart and blood tests may be required before starting treatment.

description_processed.orig: Seroquel can increase your risk of irregular heartbeat. Seroquel causes more heart problems compared to some antipsychotic medications. Heart and blood tests may be required before starting treatment.

risks_warnings.title: Shaking and restlessness
risks_warnings.description: Seroquel can cause uncontrollable shaking, muscle stiffness, or feeling very restless. However, Seroquel is the least likely to cause these symptoms compared to other antipsychotic medications. Tell your doctor if you experience any abnormal movements or restlessness.

description_processed.orig: Seroquel can cause uncontrollable shaking, muscle stiffness, or feeling very restless. However, Seroquel is the least likely to cause these symptoms compared to other antipsychotic medications. Tell your doctor if you experience any abnormal movements or restlessness.

risks_warnings.title: Higher blood sugar and cholesterol
risks_warnings.description: Seroquel can increase your blood sugar and cholesterol. Seroquel is more likely to raise your blood sugar and cholesterol compared to other antipsychotic medications. Exercise and eat healthy food to lower your risk.

description_processed.orig: Seroquel can increase your blood sugar and cholesterol. Seroquel is more likely to raise your blood sugar and cholesterol compared to other antipsychotic medications. Exercise and eat healthy food to lower your risk.

risks_warnings.title: Weight gain
risks_warnings.description: Seroquel can cause you to gain weight. Seroquel is moderately likely to cause weight gain compared to other antipsychotic medications. Exercise and eat healthy food to lower your risk.

description_processed.orig: Seroquel can cause you to gain weight. Seroquel is moderately likely to cause weight gain compared to other antipsychotic medications. Exercise and eat healthy food to lower your risk.

risks_warnings.title: Driving impairment
risks_warnings.description: Seroquel impairs your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.
risk_factors: Taking other medicines that make you less alert

description_processed.orig: Seroquel impairs your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.

risks_warnings.title: Low blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: Dizziness and falls may occur due to a sudden drop in blood pressure when you change positions, such as going from sitting to standing. This is called orthostatic hypotension. If you're sensitive to low blood pressure, change position slowly until your body is used to the medicine. If symptoms persist, a different medication may be better for you.

carousel_items: Wellbutrin makes you energized, so take it in the morning to avoid difficulty sleeping later that night.
Takes about 8 to 12 weeks to see the medication's full effects on your mood.
There are no sexual side effects from this medication.
Stop taking it slowly to avoid getting withdrawal symptoms.
Tell your doctor if you notice sudden mood changes or unusual thoughts.
The extended-release tablet shell can show up unchanged in your stool, but don't worry since the medication was still absorbed by your body.

basics.benefits_moa: Wellbutrin is an atypical antidepressant. Researchers don't know exactly how it works, but it seems to change dopamine and norepinephrine activity in the brain, which regulate mood.
basics.bottom_line: Wellbutrin is good for treating depression and has fewer sexual side effects than other antidepressants, but you need to be okay with avoiding alcohol.
downsides: Wellbutrin can be stimulating, so it can cause anxiety or insomnia the first few days you're taking it.
Generally not as good as other antidepressants for people who have anxiety.
It's less likely to cause weight gain than other antidepressants.
Has a higher risk of causing seizures, especially if you have a seizure disorder, eating disorder, or if you drink alcohol. So, it's not a good medication if you drink a lot.
It contains the same ingredient as a medication that helps you to stop smoking, (Zyban), so these two meds can't be used together.
Like most antidepressants, it can cause a higher risk of suicidal thoughts and behavior for people younger than 24.
The first antidepressant you try doesn't always work or it can cause side effects you really don't like. You might need to try a few different medications until you find one that works for you.

off-label_indications.indication: Sexual dysfunction from taking SSRI antidepressant

carousel_items_processed.orig: Wellbutrin makes you energized, so take it in the morning to avoid difficulty sleeping later that night.
Takes about 8 to 12 weeks to see the medication's full effects on your mood.
There are no sexual side effects from this medication.
Stop taking it slowly to avoid getting withdrawal symptoms.
Tell your doctor if you notice sudden mood changes or unusual thoughts.
The extended-release tablet shell can show up unchanged in your stool, but don't worry since the medication was still absorbed by your body.

risks_warnings.title: Suicidal thoughts or behavior
risks_warnings.description: Wellbutrin may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately. Wellbutrin is not approved for use in children younger than age 18.

description_processed.orig: Wellbutrin may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. risks_warnings.title: Psychiatric effects for smoking cessation
risks_warnings.description: Wellbutrin is not approved for smoking cessation, but bupropion under the name Zyban is approved for this use. Some people taking it for smoking cessation have reported serious psychiatric effects, such as depression and, rarely, suicidal thoughts or behavior. These effects may be worse if you're withdrawing from nicotine because depression can be symptom of nicotine withdrawal. Watch for any sudden changes in mood, thinking, or behavior, and report anything concerning to a doctor immediately.

risks_warnings.title: Seizures
risks_warnings.description: Wellbutrin can lower the brain's threshold for seizures in people with certain risk factors. Use with caution.

risks_warnings.title: Mania
risks_warnings.description: Sometimes, depression is the first symptom of bipolar disorder. Treating someone with bipolar disorder with an antidepressant alone can cause a manic episode (great excitement, euphoria, delusions, and overactivity). Make sure your doctor has screened you for a personal or family history of bipolar disorder or symptoms, and a family history of suicide.

basics.benefits_moa: Zoloft is a selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor (SSRI) antidepressant. It increases the activity of serotonin in the brain, which regulates mood.
basics.bottom_line: Zoloft is good for treating depression and anxiety. It's more likely to cause insomnia and diarrhea than other antidepressants.
downsides: Can cause sexual side effects like low libido and an inability to orgasm or ejaculate.

carousel_items_processed.orig: Takes about 8 to 12 weeks to see the medication's full effects on your mood.
It interacts with St. John's Wort and Tryptophan.
Stop taking it slowly to avoid getting withdrawal symptoms.
Tell your doctor if you notice sudden mood changes or unusual thoughts.

risks_warnings.title: Suicidal thoughts or behavior
risks_warnings.description: Zoloft may increase risk of suicidal thoughts and behavior in children, adolescents, and young adults up to age 24. Watch for worsening depression, suicidal thoughts or behavior, or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment, or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately.

description_processed.orig: Zoloft may increase risk of suicidal thoughts and behavior in children, adolescents, and young adults up to age 24. Watch for worsening depression, suicidal thoughts or behavior, or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment, or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately.

risks_warnings.title: Serotonin syndrome
risks_warnings.description: Zoloft can cause a potentially life-threatening condition called serotonin syndrome when there's too much serotonin active in the brain. Symptoms include agitation, sweating, muscle spasms, nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, fast heart rate, fever, shaking, and hallucinations. Take the prescribed dose only, and avoid drug interactions with other medications that affect serotonin or that slow the metabolism of Zoloft.

description_processed.orig: Zoloft can cause a potentially life-threatening condition called serotonin syndrome when there's too much serotonin active in the brain. Symptoms include agitation, sweating, muscle spasms, nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, fast heart rate, fever, shaking, and hallucinations. Take the prescribed dose only, and avoid drug interactions with other medications that affect serotonin or that slow the metabolism of Zoloft.

risks_warnings.title: Mania
risks_warnings.description: Sometimes, depression is the first symptom of bipolar disorder. Treating someone with bipolar disorder with an antidepressant alone can cause a manic episode (great excitement, euphoria, delusions, and overactivity). Make sure your doctor has screened you for a personal or family history of bipolar disorder or symptoms, and a family history of suicide.

description_processed.orig: Sometimes, depression is the first symptom of bipolar disorder. Treating someone with bipolar disorder with an antidepressant alone can cause a manic episode (great excitement, euphoria, delusions, and overactivity). Make sure your doctor has screened you for a personal or family history of bipolar disorder or symptoms, and a family history of suicide.

risks_warnings.title: Bone fractures
risks_warnings.description: Studies have shown that Zoloft increases the risk of bone fractures. It's not known why.

description_processed.orig: Studies have shown that Zoloft increases the risk of bone fractures. It's not known why.

risks_warnings.title: Withdrawal
risks_warnings.description: Withdrawal symptoms may occur if you decrease the dose or stop Zoloft suddenly. Symptoms include nausea, dizziness, muscle aches, fatigue, chills, anxiety, and irritability. Gradually reduce your dose to avoid withdrawal.

description_processed.orig: Withdrawal symptoms may occur if you decrease the dose or stop Zoloft suddenly. Symptoms include nausea, dizziness, muscle aches, fatigue, chills, anxiety, and irritability. Gradually reduce your dose to avoid withdrawal.

risks_warnings.title: Abnormal bleeding
risks_warnings.description: Zoloft may increase risk of bleeding, bruising, or bleeding in the gut. Be careful taking it with blood-thinning drugs such as warfarin, aspirin, or nonsteroidal anti-inflammatories (like ibuprofen).

description_processed.orig: Zoloft may increase risk of bleeding, bruising, or bleeding in the gut. Be careful taking it with blood-thinning drugs such as warfarin, aspirin, or nonsteroidal anti-inflammatories (like ibuprofen).

risks_warnings.title: Low sodium levels in the blood
risks_warnings.description: Zoloft may increase the risk of low sodium levels in the blood (hyponatremia). Watch out for symptoms including headache, difficulty concentrating, memory problems, confusion, weakness, and unsteadiness, which may lead to falls. Talk to a doctor right away before developing more serious symptoms, such as hallucination, fainting, coma, and death.

risks_warnings.title: Suicidal thoughts or behavior
risks_warnings.description: Clomipramine may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately. Clomipramine is not approved for use in children younger than age 10 years.

risks_warnings.title: Serotonin syndrome
risks_warnings.description: Serotonin syndrome is a rare but potentially life-threatening condition caused when there's too much serotonin active in the brain. Your risk goes up if you use Clomipramine with other medications that affect serotonin (other antidepressants, lithium, triptans, St. John's wort). Symptoms include fast heart rate, sweating, muscle stiffness or spasms, fever, and confusion. Get medical attention right away if you have symptoms.

risks_warnings.title: Withdrawal
risks_warnings.description: Stopping Clomipramine suddenly may cause withdrawal symptoms such as nausea, anxiety, agitation, flu-like symptoms, trouble sleeping, and dizziness. Withdrawal symptoms usually occur within 3-5 days of stopping the medication, and go away within 1-2 weeks. Work with your doctor to gradually reduce your dose.

If symptoms continues for more than a week, you may need to change the dose or medicine.

basics.bottom_line: Dextroamphetamine is an effective and cheap medication used to treat ADHD, but it can be habit-forming and is not used for long-term treatment.
downsides: Fruit juice lowers the amount of Dextroamphetamine that gets into your body.

Doctors should monitor children's growth during treatment.

basics.benefits_moa: Pramipexole is a dopamine agonist. It binds to receptors in the brain and helps improve movement in people with Parkinson's disease or restless leg syndrome.
basics.bottom_line: Pramipexole is an effective medicine for Parkinson's disease or restless leg syndrome, but there are potentially serious side effects.
downsides: Pramipexole isn't a first-choice treatment for Parkinson's disease. It can be used by itself, but it's usually used with other medicines.
Pramipexole can cause hallucinations in older people.
Not the best choice if you have kidney problems. Your doctor may have to adjust your dose based on your kidney function.
You can't suddenly stop taking Pramipexole. You'll have to slowly lower your dose, especially if you've been using it for a long time.

risks_warnings.title: Low blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: Dizziness can occur due to a sudden drop in blood pressure, especially when you change positions, such as going from sitting to standing. If you're sensitive to low blood pressure, change positions slowly.

carousel_items: Take Viibryd with food at the same time every day.
Your dose will need to be increased slowly over the first 3 weeks to reduce feelings of upset stomach.
It can take 4 to 6 weeks to see the full effects, so continue taking it even if you start to feel better.
Stopping Viibryd suddenly can cause withdrawal symptoms, including anxiety, irritability, headache, and dizziness. Gradually lower your dose over a 1 to 2 week period before stopping it completely.
Call your doctor right away if you notice new or worsening symptoms of aggressive or violent behavior, panic attacks, or other unusual changes in behavior or mood.

basics.benefits_moa: Viibryd is an antidepressant that is both a selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor (SSRI) and a serotonin receptor agonist. It treats depression by adjusting the levels of serotonin in your brain.
basics.bottom_line: Viibryd is a good option to treat depression, but it often causes stomach and intestinal problems, including diarrhea.
downsides: You shouldn’t take Viibryd if you have severe liver problems.
Can’t take Viibryd with drugs called monoamine oxidase inhibitors (MAOIs).
Need to avoid drinking alcohol while taking Viibryd.

Need to avoid drinking alcohol while taking Viibryd.

upsides: Viibryd improves depressive symptoms in people with major depressive disorder.
The dose of Viibryd doesn’t need to be changed if you have severe kidney disease.
Compared to other antidepressants, it has a lower risk of weight gain and causing problems with sexual function.

risks_warnings.title: Suicidal thoughts or behavior
risks_warnings.description: Viibryd can increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately. Viibryd is not approved for children younger than age 18 years.

risks_warnings.title: Monoamine oxidase inhibitor (MAOI) interaction
risks_warnings.description: You shouldn't take Viibryd for at least 14 days after stopping a monoamine oxidase inhibitor (MAOI) and will need to wait at least 14 days after stopping Viibryd before starting an MAOI to reduce the risk of serotonin syndrome. There’s also an increased risk of serotonin syndrome when Viibryd is used with Zyvox or methylene blue. You'll need to be watched for 2 weeks while taking both medicines, or for 24 hours after stopping Zyvox or methylene blue.
risk_factors: Taking Viibryd with Zyvox or methylene blue

You'll need to be watched for 2 weeks while taking both medicines, or for 24 hours after stopping Zyvox or methylene blue.

risks_warnings.title: Serotonin syndrome
risks_warnings.description: Taking Viibryd with other drugs that increase serotonin (for example, antidepressants, migraine medicines), can increase the risk of serotonin syndrome. Symptoms include, agitation, hallucinations, changes in ability to think and reason, coordination problems, muscle twitching, fast heartbeat, high or low blood pressure, sweating, fever; nausea, vomiting, stiffness or tightness. Call your doctor and get medical care right away if you have any of these symptoms.

Call your doctor and get medical care right away if you have any of these symptoms.

risks_warnings.title: Abnormal bleeding
risks_warnings.description: The combination of antidepressants like Viibryd and non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (e.g. ibuprofen, naproxen), aspirin, warfarin and other drugs that affect blood clotting can increase your risk of abnormal bleeding and bruising. Let your doctor know if you take any of these medicines before starting Viibryd.

risks_warnings.title: Risk to fetus
risks_warnings.description: Viibryd may cause harm to your unborn baby and should only be used if the benefit is greater than the risk. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications and don't use if you're breast-feeding.

risks_warnings.title: Eye problems
risks_warnings.description: Viibryd can cause your pupils to dilate, which in some people with underlying an eye condition, can lead to eye pain, redness, changes in vision, and glaucoma. Let your doctor know if you have any eye problems before taking Viibryd. You may need an eye exam to see if you're at risk.

risks_warnings.title: Activation of mania/hypomania
risks_warnings.description: In some people, antidepressants like Viibryd can trigger a manic episode (increased energy, severe trouble sleeping, racing thoughts, reckless behavior, unusually grand ideas, excessive happiness/ irritability, talking faster or louder than usual).  Let your doctor know if you've had any manic episodes in the past or were treated for bipolar disorder before taking Viibryd.

basics.benefits_moa: Lamictal is an antiepileptic. Researchers don't know exactly how it works, but it seems to calm nerve activity in the brain.
basics.bottom_line: Lamictal is most useful for treating severe seizure disorders, and for bipolar disorder with more depression symptoms than manic symptoms. Just be careful to increase your dose slowly to avoid skin rash.
downsides: Can cause double vision, dizziness, sleepiness, and headache.
Has the risk of a rare but life-threatening rash.
Can make hormonal birth control less effective.
Might be less effective than other medicines for treating manic episodes (acute mania) in people with bipolar disorder.

downsides_processed.orig: Can cause double vision, dizziness, sleepiness, and headache.
Has the risk of a rare but life-threatening rash.
Can make hormonal birth control less effective.
Might be less effective than other medicines for treating manic episodes (acute mania) in people with bipolar disorder.

upsides: Effective at lowering the frequency of seizures in people with epilepsy or Lennox-Gestaut syndrome. Typically used together with other medications for severe seizure disorders.
Works best for partial, tonic-clonic, and absence seizures.
A first-line treatment for bipolar disorder. Effective long-term treatment for stabilizing mood. Prevents both depressive and manic episodes, but the effect is greater for preventing depression.
Doesn't require routine blood tests.

drugs.one_liner: Prevents seizures and stabilizes mood.

userStories.tip: At 200mg, I developed some really nasty forehead acne and my skin was extremely oily, even with cleaning 2x/day and retin-a. I finally saw a dermatologist who mentioned he's had patients suffer from lamictal-induced acne...not just a rash.

Weirdest/best side effect from any medicine goes to Lamictal - for the first couple weeks I had really intense and vivid movie-like dreams. It gives me horrible headaches but I take it before bed so I sleep through it.
It saved my life...but titrate slowly. Too high = what I call "woo woo's"; cerebral palsy-like symptoms (full body jerks, almost seizure like but fully aware & able to communicate).
Need to monitor for liver toxicity
Blurred vision, uncontrolled muscle jerks, shaking
Double Vision is really a hassle comes and goes. Tremors, have an unexpected jerk in my hand. Have knocked things over and off the stand, but helps control my anger.

The generic versions do not work. I found out the hard way - I was switched to the generic and ended up with a very bad depression. Things turned around once the insurance co approved the brand name. It is pricey.

userStories.identifier: Woman with PTSD and Bipolar II disorder
userStories.tip: Has changed my life in evening out my mood- no hypo mania but kind of miss feeling more motivated. Have trouble initiating and have to take a lot of countering supplements to deal with fuzzy brain. Worsening soluble vision is a problem.
Doctors don't tell you it causes double vision. Also can cause fuzzy thinking at higher doses- sometimes called "Lamictal Stupid."

stick with it for a little more time b4 you count it out /don't play with doses! it took at least 6mnths (after months of figuring out and getting up to right dose with my dr) for me to realize how much less severe & freqnt episodes were!
Take it slow. Don't expect overnight changes.
supresses libido at 75 mg

I feel great on lamotrigine. Other seizure drugs depressed me.
But... not all manufacturers' pills are the same. My pharmacist must give me pills from the same generic company. Glaxo-SK's Lamictal is one of the worst for me.
Splitting up dosages in the morning and evening helps with "smoothening" out the side effects such as dizziness. Definitely take the branded XR version. Generic Lamotrigine was horrible for me.

I was on Serezone for 10 years and stopped working. I augmented with Lamictal and it made a world of difference. I have a lot more energy and my outlook has changed.  As of 2 months ago, I am no longer on Serezone, just Lamictal. It is great
userStories.identifier: Active, in great shape, feel like 40

userStories.tip: Lamictal saved my life. However some of the side effects are annoying such as neck pain,problems with co-ordination, ( have had a few very bad falls) judging distances  ( parking is a nightmare) and some  minor.skin problems. Overall the side effects are worth it to me. My moods are very stable. Very rarely depressed or hypomanic. Life is good.
take it twice a day... the effects do not last for 24 hours and taking it twice a day evens out your experience.
Extended release version seems to have fewer side effects than immediate-release.  Best to take in a.m.

userStories.identifier: Someone who has struggled with dysthymia
userStories.tip: It took a little tinkering to find the dosage that worked best for me.

Must titer up and down slowly... comes in 50mg and 100mg intervals so you can gradually adjust the dosage until you get it right. I take between 200mg and 300mg. It's the only medication that has consistently controlled my mood swings.
this is the first medication that worked for both seizures and bipolar disorder. seriously a life saver.

I have a pretty atypical case of bipolar, but the lamictal really cuts down on the irritability. When I'm in the depths of my depression or super manic, I'm actually pleasant to be around and don't take everything super personally.

Worked wonders for mood stability, best ever.  Do not miss a dose or you will go through nasty withdrawal! Have immunoglobulin levels checked before starting & monitored, as it can cause an immune deficiency.
Double vision went away when I started taking Lamictal Xr instead of the regular type. Haven't experienced any other side effects.
It saved my life.
Really I don't fell any hassle, even when I left for some time, the only thing that happened is my mood didn't go very well.
Take it around the same time every day. I have to take mine in the morning and at night. Also taking it with food helps curb nausea & any possible drowsiness.
if you forget to take it for a day or two you'll be okay but youll begin to feel it, life saver

userStories.identifier: A semi-retired writer; used to be pharma
userStories.tip: I take it every 12 hours. Insomnia was a problem for a month or so; I adapted. A problem is manufacturer difference. Some cause seizures (dose too high), so I stick with one and need to check its ID every time I pick up a bottle.

carousel_items_processed.orig: Follow dose adjustments set by your doctor to minimize skin rash.
Take with food to avoid upset stomach.

risks_warnings.title: Suicidal thoughts or behavior
risks_warnings.description: Lamictal may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately.

description_processed.orig: Lamictal may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately.

risks_warnings.title: Serious skin rash
risks_warnings.description: Rarely, Lamictal can cause a serious or life-threatening skin rash. The risk is higher for people who are also taking Depakote. Report any skin rashes to a doctor immediately.
risk_factors: Taking more than the prescribed dose

description_processed.orig: Rarely, Lamictal can cause a serious or life-threatening skin rash. The risk is higher for people who are also taking Depakote. Report any skin rashes to a doctor immediately.

risks_warnings.title: Serious allergic reactions
risks_warnings.description: Rarely, Lamictal can cause serious allergic reactions and life-threatening organ failure. Report any skin rash, fever, swelling, or trouble breathing to a doctor immediately.

description_processed.orig: Rarely, Lamictal can cause serious allergic reactions and life-threatening organ failure. Report any skin rash, fever, swelling, or trouble breathing to a doctor immediately.

risks_warnings.title: Blood disorders
risks_warnings.description: Rarely, Lamictal can lower white blood cell counts. White blood cells help your body fight infections. Tell your doctor if you have any infection symptoms (such as fever, sore throat, or mouth/throat swelling) that don't go away.

description_processed.orig: Rarely, Lamictal can lower white blood cell counts. White blood cells help your body fight infections. Tell your doctor if you have any infection symptoms (such as fever, sore throat, or mouth/throat swelling) that don't go away.

risks_warnings.title: Meningitis
risks_warnings.description: Rarely, Lamictal can cause meningitis, a serious inflammation of the lining around the brain. This can occur from six weeks after starting the medication to whenever you stop taking it. If you have any sudden rash, fever, sensitivity to light, neck stiffness, headache, nausea, or vomiting, tell your doctor immediately.

description_processed.orig: Rarely, Lamictal can cause meningitis, a serious inflammation of the lining around the brain. This can occur from six weeks after starting the medication to whenever you stop taking it. If you have any sudden rash, fever, sensitivity to light, neck stiffness, headache, nausea, or vomiting, tell your doctor immediately.

risks_warnings.title: Interactions with birth control pills
risks_warnings.description: Taking birth control pills may lower the amount of Lamictal in your body. Stopping birth control pills may suddenly increase the amount of Lamictal in your body. This can be dangerous. Talk to your doctor if you're taking birth control pills, or if you're thinking about starting or stopping them.

description_processed.orig: Taking birth control pills may lower the amount of Lamictal in your body. Stopping birth control pills may suddenly increase the amount of Lamictal in your body. This can be dangerous. Talk to your doctor if you're taking birth control pills, or if you're thinking about starting or stopping them.

risks_warnings.title: Withdrawal seizures
risks_warnings.description: Stopping Lamictal suddenly can increase the number of seizures. If you want to stop taking Lamictal, talk to your doctor before making any changes. It’s safer to slowly lower your dose of the drug over at least one week before completely stopping.

description_processed.orig: Stopping Lamictal suddenly can increase the number of seizures. If you want to stop taking Lamictal, talk to your doctor before making any changes. It’s safer to slowly lower your dose of the drug over at least one week before completely stopping.
